== Formatted blocks ==

=== XML code ===

XML code can be displayed by using the **##code##** macro with the **##language##** attribute set to the **##XML##** value.

{{include document="formatted1.wiki" /}}
{{example}}
{{include document="formatted1.wiki" syntax="verbatim" /}}
{{/example}}

When the **##indent##** attribute is specifed, the XML content is reformated with the specified indentation.  

{{include document="formatted2.wiki" /}}
{{example}}
{{include document="formatted2.wiki" syntax="verbatim" /}}
{{/example}}

=== Java^^tm^^ code ===

The **##code##** macro is used to display Java^^tm^^ code.

{{include document="formatted3.wiki" /}}
{{example}}
{{include document="formatted3.wiki" syntax="verbatim" /}}
{{/example}}

Code does not have to be emboddied in the document and be be left outside in a real Java project. A Java^^tm^^ 6 compiler
plugin allows to create a catalog of code that can referenced from a code block with the **##fqn##** attribute. The
annotation {{code}}org.wikbook.apt.annotations.Documented{{/code}} annotates a class that will be included in the
wiki code macro.

{{include document="formatted4.wiki" /}}
{{example}}
{{include document="formatted4.wiki" syntax="verbatim" /}}
{{/example}}

The same annotation can also annotates methods or fields several times, all of them will be included in the wiki
code macro.

{{include document="formatted5.wiki" /}}
{{example}}
{{include document="formatted5.wiki" syntax="verbatim" /}}
{{/example}}

=== Screen code ===

The **##code##** macro is used to simulate a screen output.

{{/example}}
